comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: This is great at large size - like time travel !

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Would Metropolitan Fire Station No. 3 (completed January 1893) have been visible from this vantage point? www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/3683566752/

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] I think you would have been able to see that witch's hat spire,  unless blocked by the ASN Co, tower, but it was not yet built. I am thinking about 1890 for the date  The GPO tower seems to be see-thru with open staircases, and no 1891 clock.

I tried to post a GoogleMapsStreetView for comparison, but it is not currently letting me copy the link.  Something to do with my trying the New Google Maps which is nearly as much of a nightmare as the New Flickr, but at least with the option to go back!

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: I am not sure whether this was taken from Milsons Point or McMahons Point, very close to that 'Leddicott' house.  Leaning towards the latter due to the alignment of the terrace in Fort Street (see note).
